Module org.example
Package org.example.bll

Class ClientBLL

java.lang.Object
org.example.bll.ClientBLL
public class ClientBLL
extends java.lang.Object
Contains the business logic part of the application that has to do with the client.
Since:
Apr 12, 2022

  • Constructor Details

    • ClientBLL

      public ClientBLL()

  • Method Details

    • findAll

      public java.util.List<Client> findAll()
      This function creates a list of clients and calls the ClientDAO class function which gets all entries of the client table.
      Returns:
      A list containing all clients in the table

    • insertClient

      public void insertClient​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String address, java.lang.String email) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      This function receives the fields entered by the user and tries to create a Client and call the database insert function. If this fails, it throws an exception
      Parameters:
      name - Name of client
      address - Client address
      email - Client email
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Exception thrown if any of the fields are empty

    • findClientById

      public Client findClientById​(java.lang.String idString) throws java.util.NoSuchElementException, java.lang.NumberFormatException
      This function receives the value of the field of the id. If the field is empty, it throws an NumberFormatException. It searches in the database for the entry with the id and if no entry with that id is found, it throws an NoSuchElementException
      Parameters:
      idString - The id to be searched by, in string form
      Returns:
      The object of Type client with integer form of the id entered
      Throws:
      java.util.NoSuchElementException - Thrown when the query fails to find a matching entry
      java.lang.NumberFormatException - Thrown when the idString is empty

    • deleteClient

      public void deleteClient​(java.lang.Integer id)
      Calls the database layer method for deleting a table entry
      Parameters:
      id - Id in integer form

    • updateClient

      public void updateClient​(java.lang.String idString, java.lang.String name, java.lang.String address, java.lang.String email) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Receives the id of the client to be updated and its new name, address and email in String form. It then tries to create an object with these values and to modify it in the database.
      Parameters:
      idString - The id for the client to be identified by
      name - New client name
      address - New client address
      email - New client email
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown when the the fields are empty
